case_vignette: A 35-year-old man presents with a 7 month history of insomnia. The patient admitted to having trouble sleeping from a young age but became more aware of how much this is affecting his health after attending a sleep conference earlier this year. He is worried that his health has suffered because of this, and he is also concerned that he will not be able to pay his bills if he were to get sick. He has no past medical or psychiatric condition and is not known to use any recreational drugs. The patient arrived for his appointment an hour early because he was afraid he might miss it. The patient is afebrile and his vital signs are within normal limits. Physical examination reveals an irritable middle age man who is tense and somewhat inattentive during the interview. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having trouble sleeping for the past 7 months, and it's been getting worse.
Have you noticed any changes in your mood or energy levels recently?
Yes, I've been feeling really irritable and tense lately.
Do you have any chronic medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
No, I have no past medical conditions and I'm not taking any medications.
How old are you and what is your sex?
I'm a 35-year-old man.
Have you experienced any significant life changes or stressors around the time the sleep problems began?
No, I've had trouble sleeping since I was young, but I just noticed it's affecting my health more after I went to a sleep conference earlier this year.
Do you have difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep, or do you wake up too early?
I've been having trouble falling asleep.
Do you consume caffeine, alcohol, or nicotine? If so, how often?
I don't use any recreational drugs.
Do you follow a regular sleep schedule, and have you tried any relaxation techniques or changes to your sleep environment?
You did not provide me with those details, so I can't give you an answer to that.
My apologies for any confusion. Have you experienced any other symptoms, such as snoring or periods of not breathing during sleep?
No, I haven't experienced snoring or periods where I stop breathing in my sleep.
Do you have a family history of sleep disorders or mental health issues?
I don't have any family history of sleep disorders or mental health issues.
Do you often worry about not being able to sleep, or do you find yourself watching the clock at night?
Yes, I've been worried about how much my trouble sleeping is affecting my health.
Have you noticed any impact on your performance at work or during daily activities due to lack of sleep?
I'm worried that I won't be able to pay my bills if I get sick from not sleeping well.
Final Diagnosis: Primary insomnia.

He reports feeling irritable and tense lately and mentions attending a sleep conference earlier this year, where he realized the impact of his sleep troubles on his health. He has trouble falling asleep and denies using recreational drugs. There is no history of snoring or periods of stopped breathing during sleep, and no family history of sleep disorders or mental health issues. He expresses concern about the impact of his sleep troubles on his overall health and worries about the financial implications if he were to fall ill due to lack of sleep.
